snippet: The White House pushed forward for Congressional approval of an attack on Syria as President Obama got qualified support from a hawkish Republican critic, Senator John McCain.
abstract: Obama administration’s push for Congressional approval of attack on Syria appears to have won support of Sen John McCain, one of Pres Obama’s most hawkish critics; McCain says he will back limited strike if president does more to arm Syrian rebels and if attack is punishing enough to weaken Syrian military.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES, MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Moscow, Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem, and Scott Sayare from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The White House pushed forward for Congressional approval of an attack on Syria as President Obama got qualified support from a hawkish Republican critic, Senator John McCain.

headline.main: President Gains McCain’s Backing on Syria Attack
headline.print_headline: President Gains McCain’s Backing On Syria Attack
